titleInfo.title: Letter no.300 of 1852 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Kemball states that he has written to Sheikh Sultan ben Suggar [Sultan bin Saqr], the ruler of Ra's al-Khaymah and Sharjah, advising him that, as per the Council's orders, compensation to his subjects affected by acts of piracy, murder and other such acts, will be paid directly to the persons affected, and not through himself as ruler. A translation of the letter (ff 147-48), dated 21 June 1852, is enclosed with Kemball's despatch.
